prior_works.title: AI2-THOR: An Interactive 3D Environment for Visual AI
prior_works.role: Foundational interactive embodied AI simulator with object-centric actions, physics, and a programmable agent API.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: AI2-THOR’s actionable objects, stateful environments, and Python control interface directly informed SimWorld’s rich, manipulation-centric agent APIs and evaluation protocols for interactive tasks.

prior_works.title: Habitat: A Platform for Embodied AI Research
prior_works.role: High-performance, photorealistic simulator enabling large-scale training and standardized evaluation for navigation and embodied tasks.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Habitat demonstrated the importance of scalable, fast simulation and reproducible benchmarks, motivating SimWorld’s emphasis on high-throughput UE5 rendering, diverse tasks, and standardized large-scale evaluation.

prior_works.title: ThreeDWorld (TDW): A Platform for Interactive Multi-Modal Physical Simulation
prior_works.role: Physically faithful, controllable simulator with accurate physics and multi-modal sensing (vision, audio) for cognitive and embodied research.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: TDW’s focus on accurate physical dynamics and controllable event scripting shaped SimWorld’s design for realistic physics and multi-modal world signals in open-ended settings.

prior_works.title: ProcTHOR: Large-Scale Embodied AI Using Procedural Generation
prior_works.role: Procedural scene generation at scale to create diverse, configurable indoor environments for embodied agents.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ProcTHOR established scalable procedural diversity, which SimWorld extends to open-ended, language-driven procedural world generation with richer semantics and task variability.

prior_works.title: CARLA: An Open Urban Driving Simulator
prior_works.role: Unreal Engine–based, realistic urban simulation with multi-agent traffic, sensor realism, and social rules (traffic laws).
prior_works.relationship_sentence: CARLA showed UE’s suitability for real-world-like physics, multi-agent dynamics, and sensor pipelines, influencing SimWorld’s UE5 choice and multimodal interfaces for embodied agents.

prior_works.title: MineDojo: Building Open-Ended Embodied Agents with Internet-Scale Knowledge
prior_works.role: Open-ended sandbox bridging simulators with web-scale knowledge and LLM-driven agents for long-horizon skills.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: MineDojo’s LLM/VLM-centered agent training in open-ended worlds motivated SimWorld’s native support for LLM/VLM agents and long-horizon learning, but with more realistic physical and social dynamics.

prior_works.title: Generative Agents: Interactive Simulacra of Human Behavior
prior_works.role: LLM-driven social simulation with memory, reflection, and planning in a persistent town environment.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Generative Agents inspired SimWorld’s modeling and evaluation of social dynamics and economy-like behaviors, guiding mechanisms for multi-agent interaction, norms, and emergent social phenomena.

synthesis_narrative:
SimWorld synthesizes three major lines of prior work—embodied simulation with realistic physics, scalable environment generation, and LLM/VLM-native social agents—into a single open-ended platform. From AI2-THOR and Habitat, it inherits the principles of interactive, object-centric APIs, fast photorealistic rendering, and standardized large-scale evaluation, while moving beyond navigation and household manipulation to richer, mixed physical-social tasks. TDW contributes a blueprint for faithful, controllable physical dynamics and multi-modal sensing, which SimWorld generalizes under Unreal Engine 5 to support broader task diversity and long-horizon interactions.
ProcTHOR directly motivates SimWorld’s push toward open-ended diversity via procedural generation; SimWorld advances this by making world creation language-driven, enabling semantically rich, on-the-fly scenario synthesis that aligns with natural language specifications. CARLA validates UE’s strengths—high-fidelity physics, multi-agent dynamics, and robust sensor models—informing SimWorld’s engine choice and its multimodal I/O stack for embodied agents.
Finally, MineDojo and Generative Agents demonstrate how LLM/VLM-driven agents can learn skills in open-ended worlds and participate in socially coherent interactions. SimWorld integrates these ideas natively: agents receive multi-modal observations, act through high-level semantic and low-level controls, and interact under realistic physical and social rules, enabling training and evaluation at the scale and realism needed for agents that must operate—and even sustain themselves economically—in complex real-world-like settings.
